result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Ely Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PLEA:

Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> GUILTY.

Court advises defendant of rights & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.  Court finds plea & waiver freely & voluntarily made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

22CM488:
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> $100 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Defendant has 30 days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Adjourned: 2:20 pm

Case Called: 2:47 pm
INCLUDES 22CM488 & 22CM491.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Michael Hughes in person.
VRCW.
Date and time set to address the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond and Motion to Dismiss Count 2 in 22CM491.
State moves to file an Amended Complaint in 22CM491 to address the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count 2.
Atty Hughes makes statements. Court has reviewed the Motion and the proposed Amended Criminal Complaint. 
Court addresses the parties and makes findings. COURT Allows the State to file the Amended Complaint in 22CM491.
Atty Hughes has reviewed amended complaint with client; Reading Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY. 

Parties address the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Atty Hughes makes arguments. 
Atty Runde makes arguments and objects to any bond modification. 
Rebuttal arguments are made. 
Court addresses the parties; makes findings. 
COURT Denies Bond Motion.
